result.execSummary:
The defendant Shane R Fusek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *Court sentenced defendant to pay a FINE of $1200.00 PLUS all costs, penalties and surcharges commencing August 1, 2016 at the rate of $75.00 per month or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
*Huber privileges for work, child care and medical.

Consecutive to: To Count 1.  Court WAIVED COSTS AND SURCHARGES due to the inability of the defendant to pay.  Court ordered any mandatory costs and surcharges due after the fine in Count 1 is paid at the rate of $75.00 per month.

DEFENDANT IS DECEASED.

records.descr: Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC

records.addlTxt: See CCAP financial payment plan application for specific monthly due dates for this OWIPP.

Defendant Shane R Fusek in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:  Court sentenced defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction; Huber privileges for work, child care and medical.

Court sentenced defendant to pay a FINE of $1200.00 PLUS all costs, penalties and surcharges commencing August 1, 2016 at the rate of $75.00 per month or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.

Court ordered Intoxicated Driver Assessment; form filed; copy to defendant.
Court ordered defendant's driving privileges revoked for 2 years.
Court ordered any vehicle owned operated by the defendant to be equipped with the Ignition Interlock Device for 2 years.

AS TO COUNT 2:  Court sentenced defendant to serve 15 days in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to Count 1.  Court WAIVED COSTS AND SURCHARGES due to the inability of the defendant to pay.  Court ordered any mandatory costs and surcharges due after the fine in Count 1 is paid at the rate of $75.00 per month.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention program report, received and filed.

Defendant Shane R Fusek in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Court grants defense request.  Parties are advised that effective December 14, 2015, this case will be assigned to the Reserve Judge presiding in Branch 21 in room 622 of the Courthouse. Case adjourned to branch 21.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed, WCS Report.

Defendant Shane R Fusek in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense counsel is not in receipt of discovery (photos/surveillance video).  Court ordered discovery to be turned over by 10-26-2015.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention program report, received and filed.

Defendant Shane R Fusek in court with attorney Reyna Morales (as a friend of the court) and Michael M. Hayes.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant qualifies for Public Defender representation.  Court grants attorney Hayes motion to withdraw as counsel.  Attorney Hayes turned discovery over to attorney Morales.  Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 24.  Status conference scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shane R Fusek in court with attorney Michael M. Hayes.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense counsel motion to withdraw taken under advisement by the Court.  Court orders case passed to have defendant evaluated for Public Defender representation.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention program report, received and filed.

Defendant Shane R Fusek in court with attorney Michael M. Hayes.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court grants defense motion for an adjournment of the pretrial conference.  Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 24.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention program report, received and filed.

Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
07/14/2015

Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
07/14/2015

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
Court orders defendant REFERRED TO WCS for supervision upon leaving court if they are eligible for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program. ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by portable breathalyzers. 
IF THEY FAIL TO REPORT TO WCS A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No driving without a valid license.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Shane R Fusek in court.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. 
Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 24.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
AODA Assessment placed in court file
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 07-16-2015 at 01:30pm
